div.a: HOW TO CONTACT THE AURORA CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT DURING THE CORONAVIRUS CLOSURE

img.alt: Telephone with Contact Us in Black Circle

span.p: If you are in need of contacting the Aurora City School District during the current coronavirus closure, please call 330-562-6106 to reach the Superintendent’s secretary, Mary Kohanski. She will respond to your call the same day. Thank you for your patience during this time.

div.a: AURORA CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT CLOSED THROUGH END OF THE 2019-20 SCHOOL YEAR - MAY 29, 2020

span.p: Mike DeWine, the Governor of Ohio, has closed all public schools through the end of the 2019-20 school year on May 29, 2020. Our goal will be to provide alternative learning opportunities beginning the week of March 30th. We will communicate the details regarding this alternative instruction schedule through our FinalForms emails and each teacher will communicate information via their typical learning platforms or parent communication program. We will continue to work together to get through this unfortunate and difficult circumstance.

Thank you,
Pat Ciccantelli
Aurora City Schools Administration

div.a: SUPERINTENDENT PAT CICCANTELLI GIVES COVID-19 STATE OF THE DISTRICT UPDATE ON COMMUNITY FOCUS

span.p: The Aurora City Schools’ Superintendent, Pat Ciccantelli, provides a Community Focus Spotlight on Aurora Schools show update on the state of the district during the Covid-19 outbreak. To view the episode, click HERE.

You can also search for Community Focus Ohio in your favorite devices or play store and look for the app with big C with the red dot in the middle. All current shows can be found on the app as well as some archived sporting events.

div.a: AURORA BOARD OF EDUCATION MEETING ~ April 27, 2020

img.alt: School Board Meeting in Chalk on Green Chalkboard

span.p: The Aurora Board of Education will be meeting online via ZOOM on Monday, April 27, 2020 at 6:30 p.m. To attend the online meeting, please click HERE with the following sign-in information:

Meeting ID: 759 1338 3473
Password: 12345
Summer School Update -

Due to restrictions being carried into the summer, we are not able to offer AHS Summer School PE, Health, or Personal Finance. Students can pursue Health and/or Personal Finance options through Credit Flex in an online fashion. There are vendors available that offer aligned courses (examples include BYU or TRECA). Credit Flex Applications (see link below) are to be submitted to Dr. Milcetich, Mr. Brookhart and the student’s counselor. (This can be done via e-mail and by copying all three people). The May 1, 2020 deadline is extended until May 15, 2020.
Incoming 9th grade students planning on taking Summer School P.E. 9 can take it next summer and pair with P.E. electives later in their high school career.

We will continue to offer our AHS Virtual Learning Credit Recovery with students completing work remotely from their own homes. Payment and form (see below) can be mailed to the high school office. The deadline is June 5, 2020.
Credit Flexibility Application (See Tab Under AHS Quick Links)

a.title: Click to read more about: AHS SUMMER SCHOOL 2020 INFORMATION UPDATE

div.a: AURORA HIGH SCHOOL RANKED #1 IN AKRON METRO AREA, # 3 IN NORTHEAST OHIO, #11 IN OHIO BY U.S. NEWS & WORLD REPORT’S BEST HIGH SCHOOLS 2020

img.alt: Photo of Front Side of Aurora High School

span.p: Aurora High School (AHS) has been ranked #1 in the Akron Metro Area, #3 in Northeast Ohio and #11 in Ohio in the Best High Schools article by U.S. News & World Report for 2020. Earning this distinction (indicating the level of college readiness) places AHS at #454 in the country. This puts AHS in the top 1% of high schools (out of 1,152 high schools) in the State. The report is derived from data submitted by more than 24,000 public high schools nationally. To view the complete AHS U.S. News & World Report 2020 Ranking, please click HERE.
To view the complete State of Ohio U.S. News & World Report ranking results, click HERE.

div.a: HONORING AHS SENIOR CLASS OF 2020 ~ The Gambit Spotlights our Senior Students

span.p: The AHS student newspaper The Gambit is running a feature that honors our students in the Senior Class of 2020. To view the student Spotlights, please click HERE.

span.p: Congratulations to the AHS Outstanding Greenmen 2020 Award winners. The 12 seniors are chosen based on their strong Academics, Service/Work, School Participation, Leadership & Character. For a complete listing of this year’s recipients, along with the 12 honored educators that were chosen by the students, please click on Read More below.

div.a: AURORA ALL SPORTS BOOSTERS MULCH FUNDRAISER

span.p: Ready to get outside and work on your yard?

Support our athletes with the Aurora Sports Booster's mulch fundraiser in conjunction with Sagamore Soils. A portion of the sales goes directly to the Aurora All Sports Boosters who help fund our athletes with dinners, banners, scholarships, uniforms, equipment and lots more! If you are planning to order mulch this year, please consider supporting them by using the link below. Click on the All Sports Mulch Fundraiser for the order form with more information.

p.span: Remember to mention that you are an Aurora All Sports Booster supporter!

p.a: Aurora Sports Booster's Mulch Fundraiser Information/Order Form

span.p: Easy order options:
Click on this link -- https://sagamoreorders.wufoo.com/forms/zxqcx7p13ursga/
Email: fundraiser@sagamorecompanies.com

span.p: It’s not too late to order a 2019-20 yearbook for your Aurora High School student. Just click on the Yearbook link below. For online orders, our school number is 5066. If you have any questions, please email kwiemken@aurora-schools.org

img.alt: YEARBOOK Click Here to Order Over Blue Background

div.a: WE'RE ALL IN THIS TOGETHER ~ Uplifting Stories & Photos from our District

span.p: As each of us is now experiencing our own unprecedented pandemic quarantine journey, the Aurora City School District is utilizing an at-home Remote Learning Experience for students. As a part of this journey, we would like to include uplifting, positive stories and photos from our district to share with our students, families and community members.

Click on Read More below to view some of the things that we think you might like to see and we will continue to update this feature throughout this period. If you have any stories or photos you think might be interest, please forward them to sdeanna@aurora-schools.org.

a.title: Click to read more about: WE'RE ALL IN THIS TOGETHER ~ Uplifting Stories & Photos from our District

div.h1: AURORA ALUMNI ~ PAVEL GALCHENKO & YOHANN SAMARASINGHE

div.p: Aurora Alumni (2015) Pavel Galchenko and Yohann Samarasinghe cofounded RVS Rubber Solutions, a company that offers high-tech B2B rubber solutions using a proprietary RVS technology to efficiently source rubber base material from would be waste tire components. The refinement process for recycling rubber in industrial environments has the potential to eliminate waste of more than 100 million pounds of tires annually. Galchenko attends Case Western Reserve University majoring in Biochemistry and Samarasinghe is studying Nanoengineering at the University of California San Diego.

In 2016, RSV Rubber Solutions won the Northeast Ohio [M]SPIRE entrepreneur pitch competition, which is held exclusively for product-focused startups and small manufacturers, earning them $60,000. In 2017, RSV Rubber Solutions was among 36 finalists chosen worldwide to compete in an international competition organized by the Singapore Management University’s Institute of Innovation and Entrepreneurship. Earlier in 2017, RSV Rubber Solutions won $50,000 at the U.S. Department of Energy’s Cleantech University competition.

Byron Spruell, an Aurora Alumni, was named President of League Operations for the National Basketball Association (NBA) in 2016. Spruell, who graduated from AHS in 1983, was named Homecoming King and was Co-Valedictorian of his class. He was active in basketball and football earning All CVC First Team recognition for football and receiving the US Army Scholar Athlete Award for Portage County. He was named as an Aurora High School Distinguished Alumni in 2001. Spruell graduated from the University of Notre Dame with a degree in Mechanical Engineering. Prior to being named the NBA President of League Operations, Spruell spent 20 years as the Vice Chairman, Central Region Market Leader at Deloitte LLP.

Former Aurora Schools’ Superintendent Russ Bennett began attending the Aurora Schools when he was in 2nd grade. He then pursued a career in the field of education and became a teacher, coach, principal and later superintendent in the Aurora City Schools. After 31 years spent in the district, Bennett moved on to accept a leadership position with the Educational Service Center of Cuyahoga County as the District Leadership Director in 2015. Bennett was instrumental in leading the district to the highest educational ranks on local, state and national levels.

Tom Curtis, an AHS alumni from the Class of 1966, was a Class All-Ohio quarterback for the high school football team. He went on to attend the University of Michigan where he quarterbacked the all-freshman team. Curtis was then moved to the position of safety and played from 1967-69. He broke the University of Michigan’s record for interceptions in a game, season and career with none of them being broken. He also had a career total of 431 return yards off of interceptions that broke the NCAA record set in the 1940’s.

After college, Curtis was drafted in the 14th round by the Baltimore Colts during the 1970 NFL Draft. He played for the Colts’ from 1970-71 which included their Super Bowl winning team. Curtis went on to play for the Los Angeles Rams and the Miami Dolphins before retiring in 1973. He was inducted into the College Football Hall of Fame in 2005. In the Land of 10’s Top 100 Big Ten football players of the last 100 years, Curtis ranks at #90.
Curtis owns one of the nation’s largest privately owned publishing companies, Curtis Publishing Company which publishes Steelers Digest and River Cities Gazette.

Kaley Ann Voorhees, an Aurora High School 2012 graduate, began her Broadway career in 2014 playing the coveted alternate role of Christine Daae in the “Phantom of the Opera.” She just recently starred in the Hal Prince Broadway musical “Prince of Broadway” where she took on the roles of Maria in West Side Story, Magnolia in Showboat, Young Phyllis in Follies and Amy in Company. She previously appeared in the Aurora High School production “Annie Get Your Gun” as the character Annie Oakley.

Caitlin Houlahan, a graduate of Aurora High School (2009) and Baldwin Wallace University (2014), made her Broadway debut in October of 2016. She has earned a Cleveland Critics Circle Award for Best Actress in a Musical in the title role of Carrie at the Beck Center. She portrayed the waitress Dawn in the play Waitress. Her stage credits include Bridges of Madison County, Parade, The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee, Theory of Relativity and Carrie. She made her television debut in NBC’s Peter Pan Live! as Jane. Houlihan can be seen in the final season of HBO’s Girls.

Notre Dame Cathedral Latin Social Studies Department Chairperson Molly Schneider (nee Kudley), who graduated from Aurora High School in 2002, has been named one of 53 teachers in the entire country—and the only one from Ohio—to win the prestigious and highly competitive James Madison Foundation Memorial Fellowship.

Madison Memorial Fellowships recognize promising and distinguished teachers by enhancing their knowledge of the origins and development of American constitutional government so that they can take the lead in educating secondary school students about our nation’s constitutional heritage. Schneider’s Madison Fellowship includes a stipend of $24,000 to be used toward an advanced degree focused on the history and principles of the United States Constitution. She and other fellows will also participate in a four-week institute on the U.S. Constitution at Georgetown University in Washington, DC. next summer.

Schneider is the daughter of Barb and John Kudley of Aurora, Ohio and lives with her husband Matt in the Four Seasons development along with their son Ben who will be starting Kindergarten in the fall.
